item.title: Embark
item.description: His love will light the way so we will stand up all together.

item.title: Christlike Attributes
item.description: The attributes of Christ depicted in scenes from His life.

item.title: Strengthened in the Lord
item.description: Youth in New York City share how seeking the Savior and following Him has helped strengthen their lives.

item.description: Youth from around the world share what this year's theme means to them and what they are doing to “Come unto Christ.”

item.description: No matter what we are struggling with, there is always hope if we come unto Christ.

item.description: A quorum comes to understand what it means to hold priesthood keys as they reach out to fellow quorum members.

item.description: The path to the temple requires us to prepare, act, and keep the temple “always in our sights.”

item.description: Young men from around the world testify of the blessings of priesthood service and being faithful in fulfilling their Duty to God.

item.description: As two brothers seek to strengthen their own conversion to the gospel of Jesus Christ, they find that they begin to have an effect on those around them.

item.description: A quorum rallies around a young man who attended scouting activities for years. With their help, he comes to a knowledge of the truthfulness of the restored gospel, and is ordained to the Aaronic priesthood.

item.title: Priesthood Duty
item.description: A recent convert to the Church fulfills his priesthood duty by inviting all around him to come unto Christ.

item.description: A family of six boys shares how missionary work has become a part of their daily lives.

item.description: The Young Men general president is invited by a quorum president to participate in a discussion of the 2012 Mutual theme.

item.description: The Young Women general president speaks with a group of young women about remaining virtuous on the path to the temple.

item.description: Elder Perry introduces the 2012 Mutual theme, and shares how we can exemplify the theme in our daily lives.

item.title: Introduction to the Theme
item.description: Young women from around the world share how they can “Arise and shine forth” in 2012.

item.title: Virtuous Young Women
item.description: A young woman chooses modesty and virtue over participation in a special event.

item.title: Heavenly Father Knows Me
item.description: After a trial of her faith, a young woman receives a witness that Heavenly Father truly does answer prayers.

item.description: With the help of a friend, a young woman in a difficult situation finds hope in the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.description: A young man exercises faith, and is instrumental in bringing his mother back into full Church activity.

item.title: Shining Forth in the Family
item.description: Members around the world testify that youth can have a powerful influence on their families.

item.title: 2012 Strength of Youth Media Trailer Video
item.description: Trailer video for the 2012 Strength of Youth Media: Strengthen the Rising Generation

item.title: Introduction to the 2011 Mutual Theme: Faith
item.description: Youth from around the world share their feelings about the 2011 Mutual theme, “We Believe," and what it means to be a believer.

item.title: We Believe: Theme Song
item.description: Youth from around the world perform the theme song "We Believe."

item.title: The 13th Article of Faith: Standing Together
item.description: Youth in Korea, who are often the only members in their schools, find strength and support as they gather with other Latter-day Saint youth in their area.

item.title: We Believe in Doing Good to All Men: Service
item.description: When two natural disasters struck their community in the same week, Latter-day Saint youth in Guatemala City found a way to serve their neighbors.

item.title: Let Every Man Learn His Duty: Aaronic Priesthood
item.description: Young men share their feelings about what it means to be a worthy holder of the priesthood. As one young man said, “Having the priesthood changes every decision I make."

item.title: Something Different About Us: Example
item.description: Luis sets an example for his friend who is not a member of the Church. He said of fulfilling his duties of the Aaronic Priesthood, “I’m representing Jesus Christ, and that’s amazing."

item.title: Becoming a Priesthood Man: Priesthood Duty
item.description: Michael strives to be an example and strengthen those around him. What started as a pregame devotional for him and his only Latter-day Saint teammate quickly became a tradition for many people on the football team.

item.title: Inviting All to Come unto Christ: Sharing the Gospel
item.description: When Junior, a young man in a small Florida branch, decided he didn’t want to be alone in his belief in Christ, he invited a friend. One friend joined, then another, and another . . .

item.title: Priesthood Men: Young Men Song
item.description: The “Priesthood Men" song celebrates each young man’s part in God’s plan and encourages him to rise up as a son of God and follow His teachings.

item.title: Honest, True, Chaste, Benevolent, Virtuous: Values
item.description: Young Women express their feelings about the 2011 Mutual theme and their preparations to go to the temple.

item.title: We Believe All Things: Faith
item.description: Daniela shares the story of how seeing a commercial on TV led to her family’s conversion.

item.title: We Have Endured Many Things: Spiritual Strength
item.description: Laura describes how she develops faith to live the gospel even though few Latter-day Saints live in her area. She receives spiritual strength from the gospel of Jesus Christ, the scriptures, and the Personal Progress program.

item.title: Guardians of Virtue: Young Women Song
item.description: The “Guardians of Virtue" song shares how young women can make righteous choices, bless others, and become who God wants them to be.

item.title: Seeking What's Good: Youth Song
item.description: E. J. shares a song he co-wrote to encourage the youth of the Church to seek the good in life no matter what challenges arise.

item.description: Youth share their testimonies of the Savior.

item.description: President Thomas S. Monson discusses the importance of the standards contained in the For the Strength of Youth booklet.

item.description: Sister Elaine S. Dalton expresses her love for young women around the world and counsels them to seek after good things.

item.title: Fulfilling Your Duty to God
item.description: “When you make a goal in Duty to God, you’re making a commitment to your Heavenly Father that you’re going to do something. It’s your duty to Him”

item.title: Reclaimed
item.description: Elder Shayne M. Bowen teaches: "The Atonement of Jesus Christ is available to each of us. It can clean, reclaim, and sanctify even you."

item.title: Voice of the Spirit
item.description: In a world full of noise and many voices, President James E. Faust invites us to listen to and follow the voice of the Spirit, which is calm and quiet and leads to eternal life.

item.title: Enemy Territory
item.description: President Boyd K. Packer shares an experience in which he was protected during World War II by listening to a prompting from the Spirit and promises youth that they will be protected if they “heed the promptings that come from the Holy Ghost.”

item.title: I Am a Son of God
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland Narrates a depiction of the story of Moses

item.title: Lifting Burdens
item.description: Apostles of Jesus Christ testify of the Savior's power to heal, change, and purify us through His Atonement.

item.title: He Lives: Testimonies of Jesus Christ
item.description: See and hear modern-day Apostles testify that Jesus Christ is the Savior and that He lives today.

item.title: The Only True God and Jesus Christ Whom He Has Sent
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland testifies of the Savior and what it means to be Christian.

item.title: Jesus Christ Suffered for us
item.description: Followers of Jesus Christ describe how He has touched their lives.

item.title: Prayer
item.description: Learn from a humble woman's example how the power of prayer can work miracles in our lives.

item.title: Significant In Every Way
item.description: Experience what it feels like for a young woman to know her true significance.

item.title: God Is Our Father
item.description: God is the Father of our spirits. We are created in His image. We have a divine nature and destiny.

item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf retells the story of the ugly duckling and urges us to reflect on who we really are—sons and daughters of a glorious Heavenly Father.

item.title: O Remember, Remember
item.description: President Henry B. Eyring encourages us to look for the hand of God and recognize the abundant blessings God gives to us daily.

item.title: The Tender Mercies of the Lord
item.description: The Lord's mercies to us include personal blessings of strength, loving-kindness, guidance, and many other spiritual gifts.

item.title: Godhead - He Knows Me
item.description: Two siblings in Ghana identify actions they can take to become closer to their Heavenly Father.

item.title: He Will Give You Help
item.description: Faced with great pain and loss, a teen and his friends in Canada turn to God to find answers to their souls’ deepest questions.

item.title: The Blessings of Scripture
item.description: As part of the 400th anniversary of the King James Bible, consider our blessings and responsibilities in having God's word so readily available.

item.title: We Lived With God
item.description: A renowned scientist testifies of our premortal life, our divine Creator, and the limitless perspective of eternal life.

item.title: Fathers and Sons
item.description: A young man in Nevada applied the counsel given by Elder M. Russell Ballard of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles and changed his relationship with his father forever.

item.title: Your Potential, Your Privileges
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf shares a humorous parable of a man who realizes he has been living far beneath his privileges.

item.title: The Will of God
item.description: God uses love-inspired correction to guide us to a future we do not or cannot now envision but which He knows is the better way for us.

item.title: Inviting All to Come unto Christ: Sharing the Gospel
item.description: When Junior, a young man in a small Florida branch, decided he didn’t want to be alone in his belief in Christ, he invited a friend. One friend joined, then another, and another . . .

item.title: Mormon Mustang
item.description: While flying in a historic airplane, youth learn about the dangers of pushing the envelope.

item.title: Until We Meet Again
item.description: Thomas S. Monson, prophet of the Lord Jesus Christ, shares the touching story of a mother who lost her son at war but learned that he would live again because of our Savior, Jesus Christ.

item.title: Stay within the Lines

item.title: He Will Give You Help

item.description: Rather than focus on her medical condition, Brittany has found comfort in serving others and trusting in the Lord.

item.title: Chastity: what are the limits?
item.description: Latter-day Saint teens are counseled to stay sexually pure, but what exactly are the limits? Using teachings of modern prophets, this presentation shows how we can find happiness and peace through staying chaste.

item.title: 195 Dresses
item.description: Have you ever noticed how hard it is to find a modest prom dress? One young woman in Arizona came up with a solution for her community.

item.title: You Know Enough

item.title: Teaching Helps Save Lives
item.description: Russell T. Osguthorpe shares a story from his talk titled "Teaching Helps Save Lives."

item.title: Men's Hearts Shall Fail Them
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson shares a personal story to give encouragement for when we feel "weak in the heart."

item.description: (4 of 7) President Eyring teaches that faith in God is strengthened in times of trial. The manifestation of God’s power at these times gives us hope in His promises of eternal life.

item.title: Ministry of Thomas S. Monson: Rebuilding Lives

item.title: Young Jesus Teaches in the Temple
item.description: Mary and Joseph find Jesus about His father's business, teaching in the temple.

item.title: Fulfilling Your Duty to God
item.description: “When you make a goal in Duty to God, you’re making a commitment to your Heavenly Father that you’re going to do something. It’s your duty to Him.” (Marcus V., 17, Washington)

category.title: March: The Atonement of Jesus Christ
category.subtitle: Videos: 32

item.title: The Other Prodigal Son

item.description: Rather than focus on her medical condition, Brittany has found comfort in serving others and trusting in the Lord.

item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson bears his testimony about the Abrahamic covenant.

item.description: Elder M. Russell Ballard bears his testimony of the Restoration of the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.description: Elder Richard G. Scott bears his testimony of the importance of baptism and the gift of the Holy Ghost.

item.title: His Sacred Name—An Easter Declaration

item.title: Bullying - Stop It
item.description: Dieter F. Uchtdorf counsels us that when it comes to hating, gossiping, ignoring, ridiculing, holding grudges, or wanting to cause harm—stop it!

item.title: Charity: An Example of the Believers
item.description: A group of young women reach out in kindness and charity to a student with a disability, fulfilling her dream and giving everyone something to cheer about. To read more about this inspiring example, visit: http://bit.ly/a5AjWz

item.title: Inviting All to Come unto Christ: Sharing the Gospel
item.description: When Junior, a young man in a small Florida branch, decided he didn’t want to be alone in his belief in Christ, he invited a friend. One friend joined, then another, and another . . .

item.title: True Christianity
item.description: When their best friend passes away, two men embark on an epic road trip to discover the meaning of “true Christianity.”

item.title: Becoming Provident Providers
item.description: Elder Robert D. Hales encourages us to stay out of debt and live frugally as he recounts a story from the early days of his marriage, when his wife exemplified the principles of provident living.

item.title: A Work in Progress
item.description: His basketball dreams almost didn’t come true, but then Tyler Haws learned where hard work and dedication can lead.

item.title: Wrong Roads
item.description: When making decisions, God expects us to pray, trust, and be believing and then not give up, panic, or "jump ship" when something doesn't seem to be going right.

item.title: God Gave Them Knowledge
item.description: Daniel shows obedience to the commandments of the Lord by not eating the King's wine and meat (Daniel 1-2).

item.title: Sharing the Light of Christ
item.description: Meet Brandon Jackson, who shared his time and love with orphans in Honduras and discovered what one teenage boy can do for others.

item.title: A Brand New Year: Physical health
item.description: The Lord has commanded us to take good care of our bodies. This involves eating nutritious food, exercising regularly, and getting enough sleep. In this video, youth from around the world talk about staying healthy and obeying the Word of Wisdom.

item.title: They that are Wise
item.description: (D&C 45:56-57) This video depicts the parable of the ten virgins, through which the Savior helps the disciples understand why and how to prepare for His Second Coming. Also included are examples of latter-day youth as they trim their spiritual lamps.

item.title: The Reflection in the Water
item.description: November 1, 2009: Elder Dieter F. Uchtdorf, using the analogy of the ugly duckling, explains that young adults can find great purpose in knowing who they are.

item.title: Boys' Home
item.description: LDS Charities partners with Food for the Poor to deliver food, clothing, and toys to children in the Dominican Republic.

item.title: The Merciful Obtain Mercy
item.description: When our hearts are filled with the love of God, we become “kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving.”

item.title: Loving Others and Living with Differences
item.description: Elder Dallin H. Oaks's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: True Christianity
item.description: When their best friend passes away, two men embark on an epic road trip to discover the meaning of “true Christianity.”

item.title: Education for a Better Life
item.description: Elder Joseph W. Sitati discusses how he overcame hurdles to get a good education in Kenya. Pursuing an education allowed him to find his wife, a secure job and the gospel of Jesus Christ. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Easily Guided
item.description: This world champion has learned how to let God take the reins.

item.title: You Will Be Freed
item.description: Through the Atonement of Jesus Christ, all can be transformed, cleansed, and freed from addiction.

item.title: A Thousand Days
item.description: By digging wells and boreholes in drought-stricken countries of Africa, The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints helps provide health and happiness to entire villages.

item.title: A Child's First Breath
item.description: Neonatal resuscitation training is one of many humanitarian efforts that fall under the curtain of the Church welfare program.

item.title: A Mighty Change: Conversion
item.description: Alejandra expresses gratitude for the changes in her life that resulted from her baptism and the joy she feels when serving others.

category.title: December: Building the Kingdom of God in the Latter Days
category.subtitle: Videos: 29

item.title: I’ll Go Where You Want Me to Go
item.description: A video presentation portraying member missionary work.

item.title: Bringing Up Children in Light and Truth: A House of Order, a House of God
item.description: (3 of 4) A discussion with the auxiliary presidents reminds us of our sacred responsibility to strive to make our homes like temples.

item.title: Extraordinary Gift
item.description: Kuha'o, a blind 15-year-old piano prodigy, freely shares his God given musical gift to bless the lives of everyone who listens.

item.title: They that are Wise
item.description: (D&C 45:56-57) This video depicts the parable of the ten virgins, through which the Savior helps the disciples understand why and how to prepare for His Second Coming. Also included are examples of latter-day youth as they trim their spiritual lamps.

item.title: Be Not Troubled
item.description: (D&C 45:16-39) The Savior's parable of the fig tree teaches that we need not be frightened or troubled by the calamities that will come in the last days .

item.title: Dare to Stand Alone
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson shares an experience he had in the Navy when he had to stand alone and reminds us that "we are never alone when we stand with our Father in Heaven."

item.title: Fulfilling Your Duty to God
item.description: “When you make a goal in Duty to God, you’re making a commitment to your Heavenly Father that you’re going to do something. It’s your duty to Him.” (Marcus V., 17, Washington)

item.title: The Rescue: Cole's Story
item.description: A young man makes a unique journey to full membership in the Church. After falling away as a teenager, he returns, with the help of missionary friends, and experiences the fulness of its blessings.

item.title: Missionary Work And Retention: Georgia Elias
item.description: Georgia Elias is converted to the gospel through family history work and begins her journey to the temple.

item.title: Sugar Beets and the Worth of a Soul
item.description: President Monson describes how to reach out to less-active young women.

item.title: Home Teaching: Encouraging Aaronic Priesthood Holders
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood holders can learn how to home teach from quorum advisers and by participating in home teaching with Melchizedek Priesthood holding partners.

item.title: Dayton's Legs
item.description: A 13-year-old boy in Arizona fulfilled his Duty to God by pushing himself to the limit so that his friend, who has cerebral palsy, could participate with him in a triathlon.

item.title: Motherhood: An Eternal Partnership With God
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland shares an encouraging tribute to mothers who, through both challenges and accomplishments, work in partnership with God to raise His children.

item.title: A Father Indeed
item.description: The story of a committed husband and father who consistently and passionately demonstrates his love and devotion to his wife and kids.

item.title: Jesus Forgives Sins and Heals a Man Stricken with Palsy
item.description: Jesus shows that He has power to both forgive sins and heal physical infirmities.

item.title: Missionary Open House
item.description: Two sisters accept a challenge from their Stake President to have missionaries and friends in their home more often. They created a monthly event called "Cake and Ice Cream" to gather friends and listen to a spiritual thought from missionaries.

item.title: Help Others Come Back to Church
item.description: Inviting others to do family history is a non-threatening way to help them feel the spirit and to give them motivation to visit the temple with the names that they find through their family history.

item.title: Priesthood and Priesthood Keys - We Are Brothers
item.description: A quorum comes to understand what it means to hold priesthood keys as they reach out to fellow quorum members.

item.title: Sharing Your Beliefs
item.description: Use blogging, texting, and other forms of communication to share your testimony of the gospel to all the world.

item.title: For Madison
item.description: A group of young women showed their love by doing for a friend what she could not do for herself.

item.title: He Is The Gift
item.description: The first gift of Christmas was a simple gift given by a father to all his children, to us. He gave us his son, the Christ. He is the gift. This Christmas season, how will you share the gift? http://www.christmas.mormon.org

item.title: Good Tidings of Great Joy: The Birth of Jesus Christ
item.description: Share the good tidings of great joy: that He lives!

item.title: Help New Members Take a Name to the Temple
item.description: You can help new members feel that same spirit by becoming comfortable with finding ancestors and taking their names to the temple to do ordinances for them.

item.title: Priesthood Duty: Preaching the Gospel
item.description: A young Aaronic Priesthood holder shares the gospel with friends and neighbors through service and testimony.

item.title: Because I Have Been Given Much
item.description: A family prays for someone to help, and their daughter is inspired to invite a friend at school to meet with the missionaries.

item.title: Missionary Mindset
item.description: Each member can do missionary work in his or her circumstances.

item.title: The Faith of Youth: The Ennis Family
item.description: The Ennis family had become less active, but they responded when ward members reached out in love.

item.title: Parenting: Touching the Hearts of Our Youth
item.description: Effective parenting means taking the time to listen and to understand the hearts of our children so that we can grow together in faith, friendship, and love.

item.description: Meet Brandon Jackson, who shared his time and love with orphans in Honduras and discovered what one teenage boy can do for others.

item.description: Notice how these young women are encouraged to search the scriptures for words that are meaningful to them.

item.description: Look for how this teacher helps these young women set a personal goal to act on what they are learning.

item.description: Watch how this teacher invites the youth to act on their goals.

item.description: Watch how the teacher reviews with the youth what they learned about the importance of the scriptures.

item.title: Aaronic Priesthood Quorum Presidency Meeting
item.description: A demonstration of an Aaronic Priesthood Quorum Presidency Meeting

item.title: Aaronic Priesthood Quorum Meeting
item.description: an example of an Aaronic Priesthood Quorum Meeting

item.title: Let Us Teach
item.description: Whenever and wherever the youth teach, they share their thoughts, experiences, and testimonies to help others become converted.

item.title: Know and Love Us
item.description: When the youth feel you really love them, you'll be able to help them become converted to the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Prepare to Teach
item.description: Preparing to teach requires spiritual focus throughout the week. The effort you make to study the outline, ponder your students’ needs, make a lesson plan, and live the principles you teach will bless your students.

item.title: Invite Us to Testify
item.description: It's important to help the youth share their testimonies by using questions and inviting them personally.

item.title: Share Stories and Examples
item.description: When the youth share their experiences, and leaders share theirs, the Holy Ghost is invited into the class and testifies of truth.

item.title: Lead Us to Conversion
item.description: Your purpose as a leader is to help youth become deeply converted to the gospel of Jesus Christ. As their hearts change, you’ll see them become unified, share the gospel with others, and repent of their sins.

item.title: Strengthen Our Families
item.description: If the youth learn and teach the gospel with their families the way they do with their leaders, they'll have powerful experiences that they couldn't have any other way.

item.title: Invite Us to Act
item.description: If youth act on what you teach, they’ll experience the gospel for themselves. Your encouragement and invitations to act can lead them to conversion.

item.title: Ask Us Questions
item.description: Asking youth the right questions helps them think deeply about the gospel. As they search their hearts for answers, the Holy Ghost helps them learn what they need individually.

item.title: Use the Scriptures
item.description: As you help the youth study and apply the scriptures in class, they'll want to study and apply them on their own at home.

item.title: Teaching the Gospel in the Savior's Way
item.description: The new Youth Curriculum invites leaders and teachers to follow the Savior's example as they teach the youth of the Church.

item.title: Help Us Discover the Gospel
item.description: Leaders and teachers follow the Savior by helping youth discover the gospel for themselves. They don't just talk. They listen carefully, ask questions, and help youth participate actively.

item.title: Determine What to Teach
item.description: In the new Youth Curriculum, leaders select lessons to teach from within an assigned gospel unit. They determine which lessons to use according to the needs of the youth they teach.

item.title: We Become
item.description: If you help the youth feel the love, peace, and forgiveness that come from the Atonement, they will become truly converted.

item.title: We Act
item.description: If the youth are going to become converted, they can't just listen. They have to act on what they're learning.

item.title: We Teach
item.description: We teach the gospel wherever we can: at home, in sacrament meeting, in Primary, with our friends at school, and in our classes and quorum meetings. When we share our testimonies, the Holy Ghost testifies to us that what we're saying is true.

item.title: We Share
item.description: To really become converted, we've got to talk about what we're learning. When we share our thoughts, feelings, and experiences, we feel the Holy Ghost. That strengthens us, and our friends, too.

item.title: We Learn
item.description: The Lord is inviting us to become converted to His gospel right now while we're young. We learn and grow when we prepare ourselves, work together, and seek the guidance of the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Face to Face with Elder and Sister Bednar
item.description: Face to Face with Elder and Sister Bednar

item.title: Fragile
item.description: “Remember what you are worth.” That is the simple yet powerful message of the 2015 mutual theme song, “Fragile.” We must be kind to others, and when we ourselves are hurt we must turn to Jesus Christ, who knows and loves us always.

item.title: When Ye Are in the Service-YM
item.description: A young man in California experiences joy as he takes on the challenge to see how much service he can provide to those around him in 3 days.

item.title: When Ye Are in the Service-YW
item.description: Young Women in Japan experience joy as they take on the challenge to see how much service they can provide to those around them in 3 days.

item.title: Follow the Prophet
item.description: Carol F. McConkie, First Counselor in the Young Women’s Presidency, describes why God calls prophets. A group of youth discover the importance of listening to the right voices when charting their course.

item.title: Our Eternal Potential
item.description: Youth consider what distractions draw them away from following the Savior.

item.title: Our Spiritual Passport
item.description: Youth consider what they will do to add stamps to their “spiritual passports” and bless the lives of others.

item.title: Sharing Your Light
item.description: A young woman from the Philippines shares her faith and hope in knowing that by setting a good example, those around her can return to following the Savior.

item.title: Texting Truth
item.description: A group of young men share how they use text-messaging to learn scriptures and uplift each other. Elder Scott describes ways we can use text messaging, phones, and more to draw closer to Christ, strengthen others, and increase our gospel knowledge.

item.title: With All Your Heart
item.description: One young man overcomes his fears while magnifying his calling.
